snippet.title: Melbourne weather: Plane misses approach at airport due to fog
snippet.content:
Melbourne's morning pea-soup fog is so thick a pilot had to pull out of their descent on a flight into Melbourne Airport. A Virgin Australia flight from Canberra was heading into Melbourne Airport when the pilot decided the fog was too heavy to land. They were forced to pull the Boeing 737 out of the landing. The flight was then diverted to Sydney. Photo: Justin McManus A Virgin Australia spokeswoman said the "missed approach" was routine and did not pose a risk to customers.Photo: Justin McManus Several other flights across numerous airlines have also been delayed, and one Qantas flight had to be diverted. Flights continue to arrive and depart at the airport. The fog is thick across Melbourne, with many social media users posting snaps of obscured landmarks.

The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting the morning fog will clear by midday, with an expected top of 15 and a sunny afternoon.Photo: Justin McManus VicRoads is advising drivers to take extreme care in the foggy conditions, activate headlights and fog-lights, and leave additional space between the driver in front.
